data.title: Bethany College
data.meta_description: The Alumni Awards recognize alumni achievements. Award recipients are selected by the Executive Committee of Alumni Council.
data.text:
Alumni Awards

IN THIS SECTION

Alumni Awards

Recognizing Alumni Achievements

Award recipients are selected by the Executive Committee of Alumni Council from nomination forms submitted by alumni and friends of Bethany. Nominations must be submitted each year and must include a letter of recommendation, and any supporting documentation such as press releases, social media posts, or letters of recommendation from co-workers or community members. Nominations submitted after the Council’s deadline announced each spring will not be considered. Finalists will be recognized at the annual Alumni Awards Celebration during Homecoming Weekend.

Award Nominees

The Alumni Council will recognize selected alumni award nominees leading up to Homecoming, and the respective award winners will not be announced until the Alumni Celebration during Homecoming Weekend. Please read through each award descriptions below to nominate candidates for the intended categories.

Distinguished Alumni Achievement Award

Awardees are recognized for achievements and contributions to their profession or field.

Distinguished Service to Alma Mater

The highest recognition award given to one recipient annually for alumni involvement, volunteer service and support to Bethany.

Community Service Award

This award was established by the Office of the President to recognize alumni who have demonstrated loyalty to the College and exceptional achievement throughout their lives, both professionally and in service to the community.

Robert A. Sandercox Award

Created by the Alumni Council in 1997 to honor Robert A. Sandercox ’54 for his outstanding dedication and contributions to the College, the award is to be presented only on rare occasions to the select few who demonstrate a level of commitment to Bethany and the educational community that is not easily rivaled.

James E. Allison Award for Teaching Excellence

Presented periodically to a Bethany faculty member. Nominees need not be alumni.

Outstanding Service to Bethany College

Awarded periodically to non-alumni who have made outstanding contributions to the mission, goals and programs of Bethany College through volunteer service or financial support.

*Not every award is given to an alum each year.

*Current members of the Board of Trustees and Alumni Council are not eligible for nomination.

Nomination Form

Type the candidate's name and class year, if appropriate, in the input box next to the award for which he/she is being nominated

ALUMNI WALL OF FAME

Enshrined on the walls of Bethany College are the names of her most distinguished sons and daughters. Their extraordinary influence and stature in their discipline, profession or field of human service at the international, national or state levels reflect the enduring high honor and excellence of the College.

The Bethany Alumni Wall of Fame is dedicated to challenging students to achieve greatness in their chosen discipline, profession or field of service; to perpetuate the renown of Bethany College and the achievements of her alumni; and to encourage all to seek and gain high purpose and attainment in life.

The concept of this memorial was expressed by Forrest H. Kirkpatrick ’27, for the purpose of inspiring Bethany students to emulate the attainments of their Alma Mater’s most eminent alumni.

ATHLETIC HALL OF FAME

To be eligible, nominees must have graduated 10 years prior to the current year and must have shown significant contributions to athletics, to their profession or community and to the College. Those selected are honored at the Athletic Hall of Fame Banquet during Homecoming weekend.

GREEK NOMINATION FORM

To nominate alumni for the Greek Hall of Fame Award, please fill out this form.
